title: Fraktur typewriter specimen example
content:
Robert Michael brought it up, i post it at typophile.  
Wonderful, with "ch" ligatur. Nice specimen design, also.  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/romibello/392161840/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110726/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/romibello/392161840/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/romibello/392161840/")
author: poms

comments.content: This specimen is dated presumably 1935, for whom who are interested …
OMG Mono blackletter. That is awesome, I need it.

Just for the sake of fun…

I translated this part, where exactly the opposite happens of what they tried to advertise. You see the "ch"-ligature problem.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110726im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ausgeglichenheit_4739.jpg)
  
_Ein wesentlicher Vorzug ist die Ausgeglichenheit des Schriftbildes._  
An essential advantage is the balance of the typeface.

\>Way cool.  
Yep, not more

A nice sample here too

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110726im_/http:/upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/de/thumb/a/a6/Schreibmaschinen-Schwabacher.jpg/800px-Schreibmaschinen-Schwabacher.jpg) from the German Wikipedia page for [Schreibmaschinenschrift](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110726/http:/de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schreibmaschinenschrift)

Anyone know other blackletter typewriter / monospaced examples?

I know of [Horst](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110726/http:/26plus-zeichen.de/fonts/horst/)  
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110726im_/http:/26plus-zeichen.de/wp-content/uploads/031.jpg)
